revised_title: Alan Hodgkin's Life and Scientific Contributions
tldr: The article is an essay review of Alan Hodgkin's life and scientific work, focusing on his personal life, scientific achievements in nerve conduction, and his involvement in the development of short-wave airborne radar during World War II. Hodgkin's experiments on nerve impulses and his collaboration with the author, Sir Andrew Huxley, led to significant advancements in the understanding of nerve conduction and the local circuit theory.
